data.title: Average Irish Bar/Restaurant
data.text:
We stopped in for brunch.  The restaurant is well kept and the dining area is very large.  A comfortable square bar is at one end.  The tater tot appetize was very good.  Our Greek salad was dry and lackluster with very little chicken.  The three egg omelet seemed plain but the home fries were very good.  Alcoholic drinks are pricey.  With the North End so close try another option.
- G & L

data.title: Excellent place for a late lunch
data.text: After a matinee the four of us had a very nice late lunch / early dinner. We ate outside to enjoy the perfect weather. The fish tacos, grilled cheese, short rib Mac and cheese were all very good, and the price was very reasonable. Service was very attentive without being obtrusive. We will definitely return!

data.title: Good food, quiet in the evening
data.text: Stopped in on my first night in Boston after checking in to my hotel. The restaurant was dead and service just ok. That said, the Guinness was poured very well and the fish and chips were delicious. I'd go back.

data.title: Very Atmospheric and Great Food
data.text:
We got a tip from our duck-tour driver to go there after the tour as we wanted lunch and were on our way to the Science Museum.

We shared a Bangers and Mash dish and it was great! The pork sausages were some of the best I've ever had and the mash had that nice caramelized onion in it and it was done with real butter. None of that instant stuff.

The restaurant is very atmospheric, all wooden paneling and lots of original pub stuff on the walls (I took a picture of a whole collections of brass beer taps).

All in all, recommended if you want a quiet place to eat good food in the City Hall Plaza area.

data.title: Food Was Good, Service a Little Slow
data.text: When you are on your lunch hour (which most people are during the week), the service needs to be a little better than it was for us.  There were five in our group (three of whom are new to the Boston working world, so my husband and I were excited to take them to a new dining place.  Unfortunately, the service was very slow, and while we all agreed that the food was good, it wasn’t the best of dining experiences as we had to rush through our meals to get back to work.  (The new workers were understandably nervous.)  Not sure why it took over half an hour from ordering to receiving our meals, but it did.  The Tuna Melt ($9.50) was good, as was the Salmon Spinach Salad ($14.50), and the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich ($11.50). Soft drinks were $3/each, and a couple of us would have liked a refill, but our server never checked back in with us so that didn’t happen.  The place wasn’t even that crowded so not sure what was going on.  I highly recommend the food, but it’s the overall dining experience that left us with a bad taste in our mouths.

data.title: Medicore lamb burger
data.text: My friend and I stopped in for lunch on a hot Friday in July.  Service was adequate.  Lamb burger left much to be desired.  For one thing, it suffered from too small a burger to the size of the bun.  In my opinion, the diameter of a burger should be at least equal to that of the bun.  In this case the burgers diameter was about 80% of the bun which is unacceptable.  In the interest of full disclosure, I have been to the Kinsale previously on numerous occasions and my experiences exceeded that of my most recent one. Enjoy!

data.title: Wonderful Lunch
data.text: We recently took out-of-town guests to The Kinsale for lunch and had a really great dining experience.  Our server, Paola, was great (friendly, attentive, and efficient).  For drinks, our guests both ordered Beers (Guinness Stout and Sierra Nev Nooner at $6.50 each) while we opted for a Pepsi and Iced Tea ($3) as we had to return to work.  Our meals were all out of this world – two of us ordered the Tuna Melt ($19 each), the White Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese ($14), and I ordered my favorite, the Salmon Spinach Salad ($14).  The total for the 4 of us came to about $70 – not bad considering all that we got!  The food is always fresh, the portions are generous, and we always leave The Kinsale happy and satisfied – and vowing to return soon again!

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: This place is probably not the first place to think of for breakfast. I was wandering by and hungry so I took the chance. I was not disappointed. Service was fast and the meal was good. I had eggs Benedict on spinach, big mug of tea. No complaints, decent meal and a good price. The restaurant decor is Irish pub.

data.title: Forgettable
data.text: Went there on a Sat eve about 7 pm for drinks. Sat at bar and decided to eat there also. The place although not awfully busy seemed very noisy and raucous. It's a big pub/restaurant and seems popular. Saw they served Guinness and opted for a pint which was pulled and served rapid. We had fish & chips and steak tips - food was very mediocre especially the fish which was in a soggy batter.  Asked a different bar lady for a 2nd "slow" pt of Guinness and emphasised "slow". She promptly told me she knew how to serve Guinness - that put me in my place ! In fairness to her she did indeed know how to pull a pint. Overall I was disappointed with the place - service was efficient without seeming friendly and the food was just mediocre. Didn't experience anything that would particularly tempt me back but then maybe our timing wasn't the best.

data.title: Great shepherd's pie and service
data.text: I ate lunch here with a large group of co-workers and the service was very good.  I had the shepherd's pie and it was delicious...not everyone can braise lamb shanks! Lots of choices and everyone in my group was very happy!

data.title: Legit Irish Food
data.text: My niece and I recently had a fabulous lunch at Kinsale … on St. Patrick’s Day as luck would have it!  Surprisingly, we were seated almost immediately and greeted by our server, Nancy C (who was great, very friendly, accommodating and attentive).  The menu is awesome … So many things looked appealing on the menu.  There is an entire section of the menu called “Irish Classics & Main Courses,” and everything looked good to me.  The items were all in the $13 to $19 range.  My niece and I both ordered the Salmon Spinach Salad ($14.50).  It was absolutely to-die-for good.  It came with baby spinach, mandarin oranges, toasted almonds and chopped tomato topped with a nice piece of grilled salmon.  The menu calls for Cajun salmon, but we asked for plain salmon and that was not a problem.  The salad was tossed with a toasted sesame vinaigrette and topped with a small handful of crispy onion strings.  We are both making plans to get back there soon … and order that same salad, it was that good.

data.title: They know how to treat a regular customer
data.text: I've eaten here 2 to 3 times a week for the last 3 years. I normally order take-out and get the bacon blue burger which has been discontinued. I work right next door so it is convenient. I also work with several people who eat here.  Yesterday (Wednesday March 16), I went there and sat at the bar and was going to order dinner and a drink. But the bartender, some lady (not the younger one) said that I walked out on my tab last week. I asked her which day and what did I order? She said last Wednesday and it was 2 Yuenlings. Well, I wasn't there last Wednesday and I don't drink Yuenlings. I always order food when I go there and I always get 1 beer and its never Yuengling. She walked away so I grabbed my coat and left. I'll never be back and I'll continue to share my experience about how they take care of long time good customers.

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: Stopped in for lunch wait staff was so friendly. burgers were great and the beer was perfectly poured. Great atmosphere cute little quaint place

data.title: Nice Spot
data.text: We just kind of stumbled into this place. It had a nice atmosphere although they left the windows open and it was a bit cold the whole time we were there. I enjoyed the food a lot!

data.title: Friendly Irish Pub
data.text:
We had reservations for a party of 6 for a surprise birthday party.  We were immediately sat.  The server engaged us within a timely manner and begin taking drink  and appetizer selections.  After drinks came out the server began to take our dinner orders. 

The dinner was delicious.

We continued to order drinks and when the section we were sitting closed,  we were not rushed by the staff  to move to the bar.

When we did move to the bar the bartender was very pleasant.

The clientale was kind of young, but it was late.  The young people were cool .  They had a live band, which was excellent.  Plenty of televisions for sports watching.

data.title: Nice Irish Bar near Beacon Hill
data.text: A good Irish bar has plenty of nooks, and the Kinsale doesn't disappoint. I grabbed a pint at the bar and although the service was a bit slow, the beer and atmosphere where good.  I tried a Bog iron stinger which apparently is only available in a few bars. For $7.50, it wasn't a bad deal and if I lived or worked in the area, I could see this being a regular haunt of mine. It was pretty empty while I was there, but perhaps it picks up after 6.

data.title: Great Irish bar in Beacon Hill
data.text:
I actually ended up going to Kinsale three times during a first visit to Boston.  The restaurant was close to where I was staying;  had a good selection of Irish entrees and Irish whiskeys; and I liked the atmosphere and the TV's.  Lately I have been in the mood to explore traditional Irish cuisine and Boston had a lot of Irish restaurants and pubs.  So I sampled several Irish whiskeys at The Kinsale and also tried several traditional Irish entrees.  Specifically Shepherd's Pie, Fish and Chips and Chicken Pot Pie.  They were all hearty and good.   And it was fun sampling various Irish Whiskeys.   I lucked out with my servers who were familiar with both the entrees and Irish Whiskeys.

It is a big restaurant with a large bar area with some restaurant seating and TV's, and another larger restaurant area without the TV's.   Overall I enjoyed my meals and the service and the fun of trying some new drinks and meals.  It's simply a good place for a good hearty meal.

Recommended

data.title: Great food
data.text: Recommend the fish and chips. Great if you want to watch the sport. Excellent selection of beers and largers. Good value and service.

data.title: Nice bar/dinner
data.text: They have a good number of different beers and some of the Irish classic. Good to watch a game with some friends and have a good beer!

data.title: second trip
data.text: We visited here yesterday for some lunch while shopping in Boston. This was our second visit to the establishment, and in view of our previous experience we expected a tasty lunch, but we were disappointed. My first gripe was the chicken sliders at 9 dollars a pop. These were presented in little buns and amounted to three sliders which were tough and almost cold .Out of three main courses two burgers were handed back due to being burned. My own steak tips were okay although very scarce, also the green beans were almost uncut able they were almost raw  .I certainly wont risk going back.
